commit_message:
Speed up release-critical post jobs

To finalize the release process for a deliverable, we publish an
announcement pointing to the releases website (docs.o.o/releases).

We therefore need the openstack/releases publish-release-history
job to complete relatively quickly. However with the current
precedence=low on the "post" pipeline, this usually takes several
hours to complete, making this (by far) the longest step in the
otherwise-fast release process.

This change introduces a specific "release-post" pipeline with
precedence=high to which release-process-critical post jobs can
be assigned. Those jobs are rare enough (and complete fast enough)
so that the impact of that higher precedence on other jobs is
limited.

Fix pinning rules so a package from main can override the one from universe

Current pinning rules don't match packages from the `universe' section.

section) has lower priority than its Ubuntu counterpart:

 # apt-cache policy ohai
 ohai:
   Installed: (none)
   Candidate: 6.14.0-2
   Version table:
      6.14.0-2 0
         500 http://10.20.0.1/mirror/ubuntu/ trusty/universe amd64 Packages
      6.14.0-2~u14.04+mos1 0
         500 http://10.20.0.2:8080/2015.1.0-7.0/ubuntu/x86_64/ mos7.0/main amd64 Packages

As a result the original version of package (shipped with Ubuntu) gets
installed into the IBP image which might reintroduce bugs fixed by
patched packages and/or break features which require customized
packages.

subject: fix external net always can be seen for rbac-network
commit_message:
fix external net always can be seen for rbac-network

Since rbac-network is introduced, a network should only be seen
by other tenant users if network is shared or network owner
create rbac rules for them to access.

But currently, for a external network, it still can be seen by
other tenant users without shared and rbac access rules.
Method _network_filter_hook in external_net_db make this happened,
for it helps external networks always not been filtered in
_single_model_query when then later one is called to query network
model.

For _single_model_query, its other inner filters are based on tenant_id
and *shared*, it doesn't make sense to make external net so special
always not to be filtered. So _network_filter_hook seems no need in
_single_model_query.

For _union_model_query, there seems no place will use ExternalNetwork
as a part of union query, where we may concern _network_filter_hook
will singly take effect.

So it make sense to remove _network_filter_hook from registered
_model_query_hooks.

This patch is going to fix external network always been seen issue and
clean _model_query_hooks.

Change-Id: I90592f7e0322fb68ed191d5e31ee1a2162b49e18
Closes-Bug: #1522709

subject: Storwize: add config option to control flash copy rate
commit_message:
Storwize: add config option to control flash copy rate

When creating a flash copy of a vdisk during a clone
or a snapshot operation the svcinfo mkfcmap operation
allows the specification of a copy rate for the flash copy.
The default copy rate is 50. The issue with 50 is it not
always an acceptable default copy rate for a particular
operator. Some operators want it slower but some want to
increase the default copy rate.

Adding a configuration option storwize_svc_flashcopy_rate
to allow an operator to specify the default flash copy
rate to be used when starting a vdisk flash copy on a
clone or snapshot operation.

DocImpact
